word[0]: Department for Work and Pensions, the
definition[0]: a British government department which is responsible for paying various types of benefit (=money paid by the government to people who need it, for example people who are poor, old, or too sick to work, and to people who cannot find a job)
definition[1]: the government department in Britain that deals with making payments to people who are unable to work because they are ill, old, or unemployed
